content:
• Monday, May 7, 2012
  • MAKO

    More on Mako (NASDAQ:MAKO): Q1 loss widens on higher costs and slower than anticipated sales of...

    More on Mako (NASDAQ:MAKO): Q1 loss widens on higher costs and slower than anticipated sales of its Rio robotic arm systems. The company now expects to sell between 52 - 58 of the Rio systems for the year, down from its earlier guidance of 56 - 62. Shares -29% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM

    Up initially following its Q1 report, smartphone provisioning software firm Synchronoss...

    Up initially following its Q1 report, smartphone provisioning software firm Synchronoss (NASDAQ:SNCR) is now down 17.1% AH. Weak earnings call guidance appears to be the culprit. (CC webcast)

  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) +3.4% AH after preannouncing FQ1 revenue of $474M and EPS of...

    Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) +3.4% AH after preannouncing FQ1 revenue of $474M and EPS of $0.52-$0.53,above a consensus of $452M-$460M and $0.48. Same-store sales rose 10.1%, exceeding guidance for 6%-8% growth. Ulta is also announcing Mousse Partners is selling 7M shares through a secondary offering. The sale represents 11% of all outstanding shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM

  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +7.3%) bounced sharply of its 52-week after Piper upgraded shares to...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +7.3%) bounced sharply of its 52-week after Piper upgraded shares to Neutral, arguing recent selling pressure should abate and that Leap's valuation is approaching that of its spectrum. Nonetheless, like others, the firm isn't positive on the prepaid wireless market. Leap was crushed two weeks ago following a weak Q1 report that featured a major drop in net adds.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM

    More on Fabrinet's FQ3: The company is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $139M-$143M and EPS of...

    More on Fabrinet's FQ3: The company is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $139M-$143M and EPS of $0.25-$0.27, below a consensus of $164M and $0.32. Fabrinet manufactures optical components for JDS Uniphase (JDSU), Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR), Opnext (NASDAQ:OPXT), and others. FN -10% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • WYNN

    More on Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN): Macau revenues +9.8% Y/Y, Las Vegas -8.1%. Macau REVPAR of...

    More on Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN): Macau revenues +9.8% Y/Y, Las Vegas -8.1%. Macau REVPAR of $296, +8% Y/Y. Las Vegas REVPAR of $202, -4% Y/Y. LV table games win percentage of 22.8% within expected range, but well below 30.4% a year ago. Shares -1.7% AH. Conference call. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM

    Fabrinet (NYSE:FN): FQ3 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $139M (-29% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

  • EA

    More on Electronic Arts' FQ4: The company is guiding for FQ1 revenue of $500M and EPS of -$0.45...

    More on Electronic Arts' FQ4: The company is guiding for FQ1 revenue of $500M and EPS of -$0.45 to -$0.40, below a consensus of $577.9M and -$0.33. In addition, EA expects FY13 revenue of $4.075B and EPS of $1.05-$1.20, compared with a consensus of $4.17B and $1.12. Revenue from digital distribution +59% Y/Y, but packaged game sales -23% due to industry weakness. Mobile revenue +25% Y/Y to $84M, but only 8.6% of total sales. EA -9.8% AH. ATVI -1.6%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • MAKO

    Shares of Mako Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO) are down hard in post-session trade after the company...

    Shares of Mako Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO) are down hard in post-session trade after the company misses Q1 estimates across the board. The company reported a loss of -$0.28 per share on revenue of $19M. Consensus estimates were for an EPS loss of -$0.20 on revenues of $24M. Shares -14% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 1 Comment

    Pitney Bowes (NYSE:PBI): Q1 EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.26B (-5.1% Y/Y) in-line....

    Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN): Q1 EPS of $1.33 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $1.31B (+4.2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.2% AH. (PR)

  • RAX

    More on Rackspace's Q1: Shares were priced to perfection after rallying ~30% from late January....

    More on Rackspace's Q1: Shares were priced to perfection after rallying ~30% from late January. Server count rose 3% Q/Q to 82.4K, and total customers rose 5% to 180.8K. This compares with flat server growth and 7% customer growth in Q4. Capex was $82M, or 27.2% of revenue. Operating cash flow was $70M, down from $88.3M in year-ago period. RAX -12.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA): FQ4 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $977M (-2% Y/Y) beats...

    Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA): FQ4 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $977M (-2% Y/Y) beats by $17M. Shares -5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • RAX

    Rackspace (NYSE:RAX): Q1 EPS of $0.17 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $301.4M (+31% Y/Y) beats by...

    Rackspace (NYSE:RAX): Q1 EPS of $0.17 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $301.4M (+31% Y/Y) beats by $0.9M. Shares -12% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • AOIFF

    Africa Oil's (OTCPK:AOIFF +36.7%) pink sheet shares skyrocket after Tullow Oil (OTCPK:TUWOY...

    Africa Oil's (OTCPK:AOIFF +36.7%) pink sheet shares skyrocket after Tullow Oil (OTCPK:TUWOY +5.2%) says the Ngamia-1 well, Kenya’s first oil discovery, may be East Africa's largest oil find following drilling more than halfway to the planned target depth. Africa Oil is Tullow's partner in the site; Tullow is the U.K. explorer with the most licenses in Africa.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • LPX

    Louisiana-Pacific (LPX +5.6%) trades up after its Q1 easily beats estimates this morning. Losses...

    Louisiana-Pacific (LPX +5.6%) trades up after its Q1 easily beats estimates this morning. Losses narrowed sharply as the construction materials company's siding segment saw sales improve by 6% and operating earnings grow nearly 31% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +2.3%) says Asian investment company Temasek and PE firm RRJ Capital...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +2.3%) says Asian investment companyTemasek and PE firm RRJ Capital agree to invest $468M toward the financing of LNG's Sabine Pass liquefaction project. The three also are in discussions on a strategic partnership focused on developing LNG sales, marketing and trading relationships and opportunities in Asian markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • RDN

    Radian Group (RDN -2.02%) dips after saying delinquencies on loans carrying Radian Guaranty Inc....

    Radian Group (RDN -2.02%) dips after saying delinquencies on loans carrying Radian Guaranty Inc. mortgage insurance fell for the fourth straight month in April, but the number of new delinquencies increased.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • CZR

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR +1.4%) spike higher after a report tips off that Penn...

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR +1.4%) spike higher after a report tips off that Penn National (PENN -0.7%) may pay as much as $600M to buy one the casino operator's properties.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • TREX

    Decking and railing products maker Trex (TREX -8.9%) takes a hit despite beating Q1 estimates...

    Decking and railing products maker Trex (TREX -8.9%) takes a hit despite beating Q1 estimates this morning, after the company issued Q2 revenue projections slightly below analyst expectations. It now sees Q2 revenue of $90M, below consensus estimates of $94M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • TVTY

    Healthways (HWAY +9.5%) pops after Dougherty upgraded the shares to Buy earlier today, saying...

    Healthways (HWAY +9.5%) pops after Dougherty upgraded the shares to Buy earlier today, saying there are extraordinary opportunities remaining in Medicare and Medicaid, as well as the domestic and international commercial markets, and the company is gaining "significant traction" within the provider market.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • THQIQ

    THQ (THQI +8%), whose future has been put in doubt by cash burn and plunging sales, is rallying...

    THQ (THQI +8%), whose future has been put in doubt by cash burn and plunging sales, is rallying after confirming it will make a sequel to the popular '06 title Company of Heroes. The game, due in early 2013, has only been announced for the PC thus far. THQ has been attempting to focus its R&D efforts on a handful of popular franchises.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • GWR

    Genesee & Wyoming (GWR +3.1%) ramps up after Dahlman Rose upgraded the shares to Buy on...

    Genesee & Wyoming (GWR +3.1%) ramps up after Dahlman Rose upgraded the shares to Buy on valuation earlier, citing optimism in its growth strategy.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • CECO

    Shares of Career Education (CECO +9.3%) shoot up after the company files a 8-K with the SEC that...

    Shares of Career Education (CECO +9.3%) shoot up after the company files a 8-K with the SEC that says an accreditor is no longer requiring the company "show cause" as to why the accreditation of its 49 campuses shouldn't be suspended.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • MELI

    MercadoLibre (MELI -3.1%) sells off after Stifel downgrades the Latin American online auction...

    MercadoLibre (MELI -3.1%) sells off after Stifel downgrades the Latin American online auction giant to Sell, citing competition. Stifel notes Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) reportedly plans to open up shop in the Sao Paulo region, and Japanese e-commerce site Rakuten is also targeting Brazil. The firm thinks MercadoLibre's multiples will have to contract to reflect heightened risk. The company's Brazilian sales grew 39% Y/Y in Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • UAL

    Shares of United Airlines (NASDAQ:UAL) move up 5.9%, helped in part by comments in Barron's over...

    Shares of United Airlines (NASDAQ:UAL) move up 5.9%, helped in part by comments in Barron's over the weekend suggesting that the carrier could be the biggest beneficiary from industry consolidation that could transform the industry from a hyper-competitive industry full of eager players to an oligopoly.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • FTR

    Rural telco Frontier Communications (FTR -6.2%) makes new 52-week lows after its Q1 report...

    Rural telco Frontier Communications (FTR -6.2%) makes new 52-week lows after its Q1 report revealed the decline in its wireline voice revenue base to be accelerating. Local & long distance service revenue fell 10% Y/Y to $572.1M, and switched access & subsidy revenue fell 11% to $148.3M. In addition, data & Internet services revenue fell 2% to $450.7M, and broadband subs grew only 11K Q/Q to 1.78M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • ILMN

    Illumina (ILMN +2.1%) moves up after Credit Suisse upgraded the shares to Outperform earlier...

    Illumina (ILMN +2.1%) moves up after Credit Suisse upgraded the shares to Outperform earlier today, based on improved prospects for sequential growth over the short-term, primarily from its consumable pull-through and the MiSeq launch. The firm also raises its price target to $55 from $48.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • FOH

    Frederick's of Hollywood (FOH +12.1%) announces that it will explore strategic options,...

    Frederick's of Hollywood (FOH +12.1%) announces that it will explore strategic options, including a possible sale. The company has hired investment bank Allen & Co. to assist it in the process.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain (NASDAQ:GMCR) slip another 2.2% to fall to a lowly $24.56 as the Monday...

    Shares of Green Mountain (NASDAQ:GMCR) slip another 2.2% to fall to a lowly $24.56 as the Monday morning quarterbacking continues on how sell-side analysts could miss the boat so badly on GMCR with seemingly alarming questions on the firm's accounting and sales growth hanging in the wind. While Josh Brown already cut analysts to sheds with his take last week, Jeff Reeves can't help making hay out of Dougherty's less-than-impressive PT cut to $80 in advance of GMCR's earnings bombshell.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 8 Comments
  • PEP

    PepsiCo (PEP +1.4%) exec Brad Jakeman remains convinced that the Pepsi brand will get its groove...

    PepsiCo (PEP +1.4%) exec Brad Jakeman remains convinced that the Pepsi brand will get its groove back after seeing market share and volume decline. After months of reworking plans internally to reverse the trend, he says the company will launch a new integrated global marketing campaign to bring Pepsi back to pop culture significance. The plan in a nutshell: Concede Coca-Cola is timeless, but show Pepsi is timely.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • DRC

    Dresser-Rand (DRC +1.4%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Global Hunter earlier today. The firm...

    Dresser-Rand (DRC +1.4%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Global Hunter earlier today. The firm considers DRC to be a core sector holding, and says the stock poised to gain from increased orders related to offshore production installations, opportunities in its North American downstream shale-gas business, plus Aftermarket bookings growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • DG

    Shares of Dollar General (DG +1.4%) catch a bit of a Buffett bounce after speculation stirs up...

    Shares of Dollar General (DG +1.4%) catch a bit of a Buffett bounce after speculation stirs up that the discount retailer might have been the mysterious company that Berkshire Hathaway failed to acquire for $22B as revealed at the company's annual meeting.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • BEBE

    Bebe Stores (OTC:BEBE -3.5%) falls after the women's apparel retailer misses the estimates of...

    Bebe Stores (OTC:BEBE -3.5%) falls after the women's apparel retailer misses the estimates of analysts with its FQ3 report and forecasts earnings for FQ4 below expectations. The retailer anticipates comparable-store sales growth will slow to the low-single digit range next quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • FSLR

    Avian's upgrade of First Solar (FSLR +3.5%) seems to outweigh Auriga's downgrade, as the...

    Avian's upgrade of First Solar (FSLR +3.5%) seems to outweigh Auriga's downgrade, as the volatile shares are among today's top gainers. Avian sees FSLR addressing new markets where subsidy dependency is not the most important, while Auriga sees new strains on its balance sheet suggesting a longer path back to profitability than previously modeled.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • PETS

    Shares of PetMed Express (PETS -18.9%) fall apart despite the company beating the estimates of...

    Shares of PetMed Express (PETS -18.9%) fall apart despite the company beating the estimates of analysts with both lines of its FQ4 report. Investors appear to be tripping up on the pet pharmacy's negative earnings growth and shrinking margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • TPX

    Shares of Tempur Pedic (TPX -14.1%) get crushed after chatter picks up that the stock is getting...

    Shares of Tempur Pedic (TPX -14.1%) get crushed after chatter picks up that the stock is getting lined up as the next target of short sellers and momentum trading in the sector starts to sputter. Select Comfort (SCS -7.4%) and Mattress Firm (MFRM -8.2%) are also selling off on heavy volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • LUFK

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK -5.8%) slides after posting a lower-than-expected Q1 profit on higher...

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK -5.8%) slides after posting a lower-than-expected Q1 profit on higher costs and forecasting a weak Q2 due to acquisition-related charges. LUFK expects to earn $0.80-$0.90/share on revenue of $300M in Q2, vs. analyst consensus of $0.95 on $316M. Q1 costs rose 35% as equipment was moved to oil-rich basins to benefit from the industry-wide shift.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • TCPTF

    Thompson Creek (TC -13.2%) shares plunge to a new 52-week low after the miner posts a Q1...

    Thompson Creek (TC -13.2%) shares plunge to a new 52-week low after the miner posts a Q1 operating loss of $16.5M due to lower production and higher costs related to the start-up and commissioning of a new mill at the Endako mine.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM

  • Jefferies is out with some cautious comments on Arena Pharmaceuticals (+4.4%) this morning,...

    Jefferies is out with some cautious comments on Arena Pharmaceuticals (+4.4%) this morning, saying the shares haven't priced in the prospects for a delay in the rollout of its obesity drug Lorqesssays. The firm reiterates an Underperform rating on the stock with a $1 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NVDA +2.8%) trades higher after Nomura's Romit Shah upgrades the company to Buy ahead of...

    Nvidia (NVDA +2.8%) trades higher after Nomura's Romit Shah upgrades the company to Buy ahead of its Friday FQ1 report. Shah notes Nvidia has a 20% free cash flow yield relative to its enterprise value, and believes the Street is assigning no value to its Tegra mobile processor business. He also sees Nvidia taking graphics processor share from AMD, thanks to new design wins with Apple and other OEMs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • GD

    General Dynamics (GD +0.8%) says it's been awarded a contract worth up to $94M by the U.S. Navy...

    General Dynamics (GD +0.8%) says it's been awarded a contract worth up to $94M by the U.S. Navy to deliver education and training support services to the Naval Education and Training Command and its Technology Center.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • HUN

    Huntsman (HUN +2.4%) is initiated at KeyBanc with a Buy rating and a $20 target, as the firm...

    Huntsman (HUN +2.4%) is initiated at KeyBanc with a Buy rating and a $20 target, as the firm sees an "attractive" risk-reward profile despite recent appreciation: "In addition to generally positive global demand trends in its core businesses, the increasing value-add characteristics of its products and growth downstream, such as system houses," should boost overall profitability.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • EPAY

    Bottomline Technologies (EPAY -23.3%), a provider of payment management software/services, tanks...

    Bottomline Technologies (EPAY -23.3%), a provider of payment management software/services, tanks after its FQ3 revenue slightly misses Street estimates. The shortfall comes in spite of a 51% Y/Y increase in subscription/transaction revenue, a business it recently expanded by acquiring Intuit's cloud-based commercial banking platform. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • LEA

    Lear (LEA +1.1%) moves higher this morning after Morgan Stanley upgraded the shares to...

    Lear (LEA +1.1%) moves higher this morning after Morgan Stanley upgraded the shares to Overweight based on a more attainable consensus estimate, lower operational cost structure and improved balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • IMAX

    IMAX (IMAX +1.3%), Dolby Laboratories (DLB +2.3%), and RealD (RLD +0.7%) all trade higher on...

    IMAX (IMAX +1.3%), Dolby Laboratories (DLB +2.3%), and RealD (RLD +0.7%) all trade higher on enthusiasm stirred up by strong movie ticket sales for blockbuster The Avengers. One of the reasons Disney's movie is blowing past the impressive numbers rung up by The Hunger Games is that close to half of the tickets sold are for the higher-priced 3D editions - helping shine a spotlight back on 3D-related companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE +4.1%) rallies after announcing an LED lighting control system in partnership with...

    Cree (CREE +4.1%) rallies after announcing an LED lighting control system in partnership with Lutron Electronics. The solution, evidence of Cree's ongoing efforts to target business customers willing to pay the higher prices attached to LED lighting products, will be available this summer. (PR) (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +5.3%), hit hard recently by accounting woes and a board shakeup, is rallying...

    Groupon (GRPN +5.3%), hit hard recently by accounting woes and a board shakeup, is rallying after B. Riley upgraded shares to Neutral on valuation grounds. Also possibly helping is CEO Andrew Mason's annual letter to shareholders. Mason touts Groupon's strong mobile uptake (now accounts for 30% of North American transactions), and a doubling in the effectiveness of its SmartDeals personalization algorithm.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 5 Comments
  • TA

    TravelCenters of America (TA -12.1%) falls after seeing operating costs jump higher in Q1 and...

    TravelCenters of America (TA -12.1%) falls after seeing operating costs jump higher in Q1 and filing a $500M mixed securities shelf registration with the SEC.
